Topic.Title: Today was a text book double top into a full blown reversal...

Message.Msg: Fine with me. I have LT puts. But, vol is awful low right now. Normally they juice it nicely going into earnings to scalp more premium on earnings. Will be tough to do if holding its in place. More likely they will take it to just above a critical support level and get both call and put buyers to pay a premium...

Topic.Title: Today was a text book double top into a full blown reversal...

Message.Msg: roger that...buying calls and puts pre-earnings on a high premium stock like amzn is a sure fire way to go broke. 95 percent of option buyers (long or short) lose their tails buying options looking for an earnings move one way or another.
255-260 in the near future

Message.Msg: Not yet -- I'll explain in another month or so. You only understand options as a trading vehicle and not an investment vehicle -- mainly because you and most of the folks transacting options are mainly focused upon ST (weekly/monthly) options where theta decay is crushing and holding is flat out stupid. Message.Title: Think conservatively in terms of a 1000 PE
Message.Msg: Amazon will continue to defy the logic of conventional earnings valuations for at least another decade.

Message.Msg: I was watching some trade videos on TheContrarianTrader blog and found some great videos. His analysis was really good and be being new I got a lot out of them. I watched his older videos and his calls were accurate as well. Does anyone know of his paid services?

Message.Title: Will be a bad quarter
Message.Msg: It looks like Amazon agreed to start collecting sales tax in California in September. It's widespread knowledge that Amazon's sales shrink by 20% in states where Amazon starts collecting sales tax. Doesn't look good this quarter on that fact alone.

Widespread knowledge? Really. Why don't you point to a few public references to that widespread knowledge? Actually, the stock up effect, couple with new product launches should juice sales this Q. But, Amazon is in trouble for the vastly more important holiday quarter, which is why it is trying to finance its sellers and is refusing to collect sales tax on 3rd party sales in California. It's going to be fun when all misdirections and misrepresentations are exposed... But, I wouldn't count on a bad Q4. Having said that, if it has a bad Q3, Q4 will be a trainwreck...
"I wonder why they didn't renew the lease?" Maybe they couldn't afford to?
